data.event: In 1832 George Barnes purchased the land that would become Charlotte from the U.S. Government. Barnes in turn sold the land to Edmond B. Bostwick, a land speculator from New York City three years later in 1835.

event.title: sold the land to Edmond B. Bostwick, a land speculator from New York City three years later

data.event: In 1832 George Barnes purchased the land that would become Charlotte from the U.S. Government. Barnes in turn sold the land to Edmond B. Bostwick, a land speculator from New York City three years later in 1835.

event.title: became the first postmaster on March 17, 1838

data.event: Jonathan Searles became the first postmaster on March 17, 1838.

event.title: was incorporated as a village on October 10, 1863

data.event: Charlotte was incorporated as a village on October 10, 1863, and as a city on March 29, 1871.
It was designated as the county seat when Eaton County was organized in 1837; however, due to a lack of population and buildings, county functions were conducted at Bellevue until 1840.
